name: Endpoint Configuration
description:
Typical Use Cases

- A vRA Administrator or a Solution User creates an endpoint category.
- The vRA administrator registers a new endpoint type with the endpoint configuration service.
- The IaaS administrator creates, updates or deletes an endpoint through the UI. vRA then calls the endpoint configuration service to create, update or delete endpoint information.

requests.name: Gets vSphere endpoints by type
requests.description: The API returns paged list of endpoints.

requests.name: Creates a NSX endpoint (associate with vSphere)
requests.description: Create a NSX endpoint and associating it with vSphere endpoint.

requests.name: Create Infrastructure category
requests.description:
The API creates a new endpoint type category. The API validates that the endpoint type category does not exist already, before creating new endpoint type category. 

Note: This is only available for system admin.

requests.name: Login with System User
requests.description: Returns a token associated with the system user credentials. (e.g. administrator@vsphere.local)

requests.name: Gets paged list of endpoints
requests.description: The API returns paged list of endpoints.

requests.name: Login with tenant user
requests.description: Returns a token associated with the provided credentials. e.g. (username@domain)

requests.name: Gets paged list of endpoint types
requests.description: The API returns paged list of endpoint types.

requests.name: Create a Jenkins endpoint type
requests.description:
Creates an endpoint type for Jenkins system.

Note: Only system admin or infra admin can create endpoint type.

requests.name: Gets vSphere to NSX association Type
requests.description: The API returns vSphere to NSX association type. Make note of the "id" field which will be required in creating NSX endpoint.

requests.name: Creates a new vSphere endpoint
